description: Paste and upload image to S3-Compatible storage. Works in remote development environments.
command.testS3Connection.title: Test S3 Connection
command.undoRecentUpload.title: Undo Recent Upload
configuration.title: Paste and Upload
configuration.s3.region.description: The region of the S3-compatible storage. Must be set.
configuration.s3.endpoint.description: The endpoint of the S3-compatible storage. Leave empty if you are using AWS S3.
configuration.s3.accessKeyId.description: The access key ID of the S3-compatible storage. Can be left empty if your bucket does not require authentication to upload files (Not recommended).
configuration.s3.secretAccessKey.descrip: The secret access key of the S3-compatible storage. Can be left empty if your bucket does not require authentication to upload files (Not recommended).
configuration.s3.bucket.description: The bucket of the S3-compatible storage. Must be set.
configuration.s3.prefix.description: The path prefix that will be used to store the files. For example, `images/` will store the files in the `images` folder. (Slashes will be preserved).
configuration.s3.publicUrlBase.descripti: The base that should be prepended to the file name to generate the final link. For example, `https://example.com/imgs/` will generate the URL `https://example.com/imgs/image.png`. The path prefix should be manually added to the base URL (slashes will be preserved), or handled by your reverse proxy.
configuration.s3.omitExtension.descripti: Do not include the file extension in the uploaded file name (key).
configuration.s3.skipExisting.descriptio: Skip uploading if the file already exists in the destination. Useful when file names are generated based on the content hash.
configuration.s3.forcePathStyle.descript: Whether to force path style URLs for S3 objects. Useful for S3-compatible storage that doesn't support virtual-hosted-style URLs.
configuration.s3.clientOptions.descripti: Additional S3 client options in JSON format. These options will be merged into the S3Client configuration. See [AWS SDK S3Client documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSJavaScriptSDK/v3/latest/clients/client-s3/interfaces/s3clientconfig.html) for available options.
configuration.workspace.path.description: The path where the files will be saved locally. The path is relative to the workspace folder.
configuration.workspace.linkBase.descrip: The base that should be prepended to the file name to generate the final link.
configuration.uploadDestination.descript: The destination where the files will be uploaded.
configuration.uploadDestination.enum.s3: Upload the files to the S3-compatible storage.
configuration.uploadDestination.enum.wor: Save the files locally in the workspace.
configuration.fileSizeLimit.description: File size limit in bytes. Users will be prompted to confirm the upload if the file size exceeds this limit. Set to 0 to disable the limit.
configuration.allowMultipleFiles.descrip: Allow multiple files to be uploaded at once.
configuration.mimeTypeDetectionMethod.de: How to detect the MIME type of the files when the clipboard does not provide it.
configuration.mimeTypeDetectionMethod.en: Detect the MIME type of the files based on magic bytes in the content, and fallbacks to file extension when failed
Detect the MIME type of the files based on the file extension
Do not detect the MIME type of the files, use `application/octet-stream` as the default MIME type
configuration.keepOriginalFilename.descr: Keep the original file name when uploading files. If disabled, a random name will be generated. Default file names like `image.png` will always be renamed.
configuration.fileNamingMethod.descripti: The method used to generate the file name when `#paste-and-upload.keepOriginalFilename#` is disabled, or when the file name is not provided by the clipboard.
configuration.fileNamingMethod.enum.md5: MD5 hash of the file content.
configuration.fileNamingMethod.enum.md5S: Short (8 Digits) MD5 hash of the file content.
configuration.fileNamingMethod.enum.prom: Prompt the user for a name.
configuration.defaultSnippet.description:
The default snippet that will be inserted in the document after uploading. The following variables can be used: 

- `${url}`
- `${filename}`
- `${filenameWithoutExtension}`
- `${extension}`
- `${mimeType}`
configuration.imageSnippet.description:
The default snippet that will be inserted in the document after uploading. The following variables can be used: 

- `${url}`
- `${filename}`
- `${filenameWithoutExtension}`
- `${extension}`
- `${mimeType}`
configuration.undoLimit.description: The maximum number of undo uploads that can be performed. Set to 0 to disable the undo feature.
configuration.mimeTypeFilter.description: A regular expression that matches the MIME types that should be uploaded, for example, `image/.*` will only upload images. Leave empty to upload any MIME type. Note that the MIME type of text files is not reliably detected, and will be treated as `application/octet-stream` if the detection fails.
configuration.ignoreWorkspaceFiles.descr: Ignore files that are already in the workspace when uploading files. Other extensions like the built-in Markdown extension may handle these files.
configuration.retrieveOriginalImage.desc: Whether to try to download the original image from the clipboard when pasting. This is useful for pasting animated images from browsers like Microsoft Edge, which only provide a static image in the clipboard.
